column4: Hi, where can I read about salary rates for unix/linux professionals - sysad/system programmers/kernel programmers/ , say in Australia, USA, New Zealand, etc., I prefer, pure income ( with reduced tax) numbers
intersting countries to pick
sorry, i don't know off the top of my head. i would have to ask around (and take a day or t2)
why "interesting" ?
partly because i live in aust, and because your IP is not in one of those countries (it looks lik eitaly?)
it isn't italy. you know, there are utilities like host, nslookup, if you're so nosy
I'm not particularly, but i do look at hostmasks as people join
fair enough :)
so, how do all the above professions live like ... ? ok ? nice ?
i don't know many admins, but they don't get particularly special rates (the ones i know), but they can be paid a lot. as i said, i only know a few in aust
I don't know. I think it should parallelize.
i would like it to, but I'm not a dev ;)
then become one
i cant program... yet....
anyone can program
i have a website to write, then x86 assembly to learn, then I'm moving onto C++
you're wrong :)
my bad ;)
learn structural language, like C or Pascal ( which is more structured )

the easiest, and the most comprehensible way of thinking is structural, then play with asm, whilst learning computer arch. and only then move to python, it is Object oriented enough and a great language for both scripts and programs.
satanic :D
